Daily Market Brief:
northmantrader.com/2025/07/2‚Ä¶

Institutional investors are STILL selling to retail:

Institutional Investors sold -$800 million in single stocks and ETFs last week, building on -$2.4 billion in the previous week.

This marks their 10th week of selling out of the last 11.

Over the last 4 weeks, institutional investors have sold -$8.5 billion in equities in total.

On the other hand, corporations bought back +$1.2 billion of their own stock, while retail and hedge funds purchased +$1.2 billion and +$400 million, respectively.

Retail investors have now been net buyers for 30 out of the last 32 weeks.

Wall Street vs Main Street continues.

As of mid-July, states with largest y/y increase in serious mortgage delinquency rates (90 or more days past due) were Florida, South Carolina, and Georgia ... states that saw largest declines were New York, Hawaii, and Rhode Island per ‚Å¶@cotality‚Å©

Trump is going to the Federal Reserve tomorrow, according to his schedule.

Only three presidents have visited the Fed. FDR when its HQ building opened in 1938, Ford when a buddy of his became a governor, and George W. Bush for the swearing in of Ben Bernanke.

Tomorrow (Thursday), Trump is visiting the renovation of the Federal Reserve building for about an hour.

Of course, it's a publicity stunt. But it also represents a danger for Jay Powell.

Every government construction project, whether it's a municipal sewer project, building a new high school, or remodeling the Federal Reserve Building, is rife with waste, fraud, and abuse. Sadly, this is how government works.

Giving the remodeling of the Federal Reserve building an anal exam can find "For Cause" reasons to fire Powell, if this is what they genuinely want and are willing to look hard enough for it.

IBM $IBM CEO Arvind Krishna:

"Our generative AI book of business continues to 
accelerate and now stands at more than $7.5 billion."

This is up from $6 billion in Q1.

ServiceNow's $NOW RPO grew 29% YoY to $23.9 billion, accelerating from 25% in Q1, while current RPO rose 24.5% YoY to $10.92 billion. 

$NOW also guided for Q3 subscription growth of 20-20.5% YoY to $3.26-3.265B.

$CRM $AMZN $GOOG

ServiceNow $NOW reported revenue of $3.22 billion, up 22.5%, while adjusted EPS of $4.13 beat estimates for $3.57. 

Now Assist is "firmly on track" to reach its $1 billion ACV target by 2026.

$CRM $MSFT $AMZN $GOOG
Tesla $TSLA says that it started initial production of a more affordable model in June, with volume production planned for the second half of this year.

Alphabet $GOOG capex was $22.45 billion in Q2, up 70% YoY, accelerating from 43% growth in Q1. 

Alphabet also boosted its capex forecast for 2025 from $75 billion to $85 billion.

$AMZN $MSFT $NVDA $AVGO

Google Cloud $GOOG operating margin expanded significantly in Q2, up more than 9 points YoY to 20.7% as operating income rose more than 141% to $2.83B.

$MSFT $AMZN

Alphabet $GOOG reported $2.31 in EPS in Q2, up 22% YoY, while revenue rose 14% YoY to $96.4 billion.

Search revenue rose 12% YoY to $54.2 billion, while Cloud revenue accelerated 3 points to 32% YoY to $13.6 billion.

$MSFT $AMZN

ServiceNow $NOW is expected to report 14.1% earnings growth to $3.57 in Q2, with revenue rising 18.6% to $3.12 billion. 

ServiceNow's Now Assist ACV contribution is expected to reach $1B by the end of 2026, up from $250M in May.

$GOOG $AMZN $MSFT $CRM

Tesla $TSLA is expected to report a (22.2%) YoY decline in adjusted EPS to $0.40, while revenue is projected to decline (13.2%) YoY to $22.13B in Q2. 

Tesla said last quarter that it would revisit its 2025 guidance in Q2's update.

While Dell $DELL and others have likely started early production of Nvidia‚Äôs $NVDA Blackwell Ultra systems, larger scale shipments of the GB300 NVL72 are expected to ramp in September. 

$SMCI $AMD $CRWV

Alphabet $GOOG is expected to report 16.4% growth in EPS to $2.20 in Q2, with revenue rising 10.9% to $94 billion.

Cloud growth is expected to be 27% YoY, while Search ads are expected to grow 9% YoY.

$AMZN $MSFT $GOOGL

Robinhood $HOOD CEO Vlad Tenev said that nearly 100% of the company‚Äôs software engineers are using AI tools such as Cursor or Windsurf to write code, with nearly 50% of all code being AI generated.

$GOOG $AMZN $MSFT $GTLB

OpenAI is working to integrate a payment checkout system into ChatGPT, and any merchants fulfilling orders via the checkout system will pay a commission to OpenAI.

$MSFT $AMZN $GOOG

xAI has 230K GPUs, with 30K $NVDA GB200s, operational in its Colossus 1 supercluster for training Grok.

At Colossus 2, Musk announced that the first batch of 550K $NVDA GB200s and GB300s will start going online in a few weeks.

The distribution rate = Latest distribution annualized / current NAV

The 30-day SEC yield is a standardized measure of the income earned by a fund, typically a bond fund or ETF, over a 30-day period, annualized to provide an estimated annual return.

* The Distribution Rate and 30-Day SEC Yield is not indicative of future distributions, if any, on the ETFs. In particular, future distributions on any ETF may differ significantly from its Distribution Rate or 30-Day SEC Yield. You are not guaranteed a distribution under the ETFs. Distributions for the ETFs (if any) are variable and may vary significantly from month to month and may be zero. Accordingly, the Distribution Rate and 30-Day SEC Yield will change over time, and such change may be significant. The distribution may include a combination of ordinary dividends, capital gain, and return of investor capital, which may decrease a fund‚Äôs NAV and trading price over time. As a result, an investor may suffer significant losses to their investment. These distribution rates caused by unusually favorable market conditions may not be sustainable. Such conditions may not continue to exist and there should be no expectation that this performance may be repeated in the future. Stated distribution frequency subject to change. I don't know if an author could ask for a better testimonial. I've heard this thousands of times, but it still makes me feel good inside.

As is often the case, uncertainty breeds opportunity ‚Äî especially in high-quality stocks forming constructive bases aligned with our Leadership Profile. But opportunity alone means nothing without patience, discipline, and a relentless commitment to strategy and process.
Not every setup will work ‚Äî and the not working part is part of every strategy. When the ‚Äúgood‚Äù ones start to fail, it‚Äôs time to activate what I call ‚ÄúSit Out Power.‚Äù
It‚Äôs not that the strategy is broken. It‚Äôs not that the charts or VCP characteristics don't work. It simply means the time isn‚Äôt right ‚Äî and when that‚Äôs the case, the smartest move is to do little or nothing.
Good trading doesn‚Äôt reward heroics. It rewards patience, precision, and process ‚Äî all driven by unwavering discipline.
One of the most important parts of MY process is this:
You don't get aggressive by chance or just because. You earn the right to play big.
Until then, we manage risk and wait. Period.
